website_summaries.verdict: A 2-pack worth considering if you like the streamlined design and smart features – all at a good price.
pros: Small design that doesn't take up 2 outlets and energy-monitoring capability that helps save electricity
No hub needed and app is free
cons: Difficult to set up and sync to Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the app, needs access to everything on your phone.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I missed the return period. The app for this item needs access to my location, docs and files, camera, and call information among many other areas. Why does a wall plug need access to my photos is beyond me. Lost money on something I'd never use because it won't function without the app.
customer_reviews.author: amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Respond to voice commands about 75% of the time.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to connect them easily enough. However frequently when giving them a voice command they make a clicking noise and then fail to take action. Alexa says they are unresponsive, and the app reports them as offline. They will flash for a while and eventually come back. They work about 75% of the time. That is not enough. Both of the switches in my two pack have the same problem. Returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Arpad

customer_reviews.title: Need external 3rd party account to operate
customer_reviews.text: This indicated it worked with Alexa, and while that may be true, it also requires an account with a third party in order to work. I don't need an account with a 3rd party to turn on a socket.
customer_reviews.author: fdt

customer_reviews.title: Mystery bag of smart plugs
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this product twice. The first time i received 10 AMP plugs.... this time I received 8 AMP plugs. The description and details on the page doesn't speak to the AMPs. I'm assuming when there are Sales, Specials, or "lightning deals" for great prices.... that the 8 AMP plugs are being sent out. There needs to be a listing for 8 AMP and a listing for 10 AMP separately. I can't give anything higher than a 1 Star rating because you have no idea what AMP you are getting till it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Wallace Bryant

customer_reviews.title: It sees you when you're sleeping, and knows when you're awake
customer_reviews.text: I bought these but didn't end up installing. When I opened the [Privacy Agreement] for the specified mobile app, I noticed that you are agreeing to be monitored down to your website viewing habits. I'm not going to pretend I am unaware of existing tracking (yes, looking even at you, Amazon: thanks for the spot-on shopping recommendations and all that), but for this little gadget (and accompanying app) to require that level of tracking/monitoring is absurd. I'll just let them buy my information from one of the other hundreds of companies that probably already has it and sells it.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time.  Problem connecting to network
customer_reviews.text: This product is not ready for prime time. I cannot use the VeSync app to connect the device to my Wifi network after multiple attempts. The app offers to connect me via a new network, which it probably created, but it would require my phone to choose this newly created network, instead of the one it has always used. I didn't think that was a good idea. If an IOT product has trouble connecting to a wifi router, how can the customer has confidence in its reliability?
customer_reviews.author: Nottingham

customer_reviews.title: Works OK for Me
customer_reviews.text: I had a difficult time trying to connect the first smart plug to our wifi system. I followed instructions; retried things, reset it etc. FINALLY, it connected to the wifi. Connecting the second plug was a snap. It was very easy to set these up with Amazon Echo. It works well so far. The reason for 4 stars is because of the size of the plugs. They are quite large in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: HighlandAngelTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Unresponsive Junk
customer_reviews.text: One of these is constantly unavailable or unresponsive. I was told that it's possible it was too far away from my wifi router, so I wasted another $75 to run new cat6 cable out to my garage and install a WiFi access point next to the device. Tonight it did it again. Nonresponsive. Junk IMHO. Had to work out to the garage and re setup the device, which completely defeats the purpose of a remote device.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I got them to work but there is a safety option in the app which they want you to have turned on but when it is on it trips all the time no matter what you have plugged into it. The max is 1000 Watts. I even tried a 5 watt LED lamp and it stated that it went over 900 watts which is not possible. I did contact support but they emailed me back one time and now they have disappeared. No more contact. Update: 3 months later 1 of my outlets lost connection and now it won't connect back to my network. I have tried all of the available options to reconnect but nothing. Again Useless.
customer_reviews.author: loco1529

customer_reviews.title: Awesome plugs!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these plugs! Bought them on Cyber Monday and now buying more. Got them originally for our Christmas tree and inside holiday lights but now realized all the other uses for them. Another great feature besides the Alexa control is the app control. You can turn lights on and off with the app too. You can even turn them on and off when on the road. That comes in handy especially when you leave the house and wonder if you turned the lights off. Great plugs!
customer_reviews.author: M. Farrell

customer_reviews.title: and this smart plug performs the best
customer_reviews.text: I've tried two other brands (HAUSBELL and TP-LINK), and this smart plug performs the best. Its smaller and and you can configure it so the light only activates when the WIFI link is dead. Its smart phone app is easy to use and set up various timers for multioke devices. The connection to Alexa works after you add the smart home skill for the app Versync. These plugs also monitor energy usage for plug so you can use it for more than a remote for lights.
customer_reviews.author: M. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: So far, garbage.
customer_reviews.text: So far, my experience with these has been dismal. I'll update this if I figure out what is going on. These refuse to run a simple small household box fan, nothing major, no high power draw. They either click on and then click off immediately, work randomly, or show up as offline in the app. You get what you pay for has been my experience. I'll be returning or trashing these and either getting more of the Iris plugs (that work flawlessly even on my high power draw space heaters) or investing in some wemo plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn

customer_reviews.title: App needs work.
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues with setup of the outlets but heed the warnings about the app. It works to turn on/off items remotely but good luck having a schedule work. Setting a schedule is simple, the issue is that the app changes the times of the schedule you set seemingly randomly. I had an outlet set to come on at 5:30 PM and off at 10:30 PM. The times in the app changed to 2:30 AM and some other random time to turn it off. If your intention is to just use the app to turn on/off items manually it seems to work fine. Scheduling is the issue I had.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Network integrity?
customer_reviews.text: The product requires their app (downloaded from G-Store) for setup and control. After completing registration, I began the setup procedure following the app's instructions. As with many wifi products, the app guides you and then asks you change wifi network to their proprietary network for completion. Afterward you would normally be returned to your original network. This last step did not follow script, instead attaching to a completely different network, and one for which it is not designed -5k. That the program did not return to the original network and choose another (any other) is an unacceptable breach of programming integrity. Caution
customer_reviews.author: DRC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with every wi-fi
customer_reviews.text: Read the whole description, down to the last lines, where you will find if you don't have the right wi-fi, they won't work with Alexa. I was very annoyed and wish they had put that info at the TOP of their description. They went back.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl from Manassas

customer_reviews.title: Powers itself off for absolutely no reason
customer_reviews.text: I can not trust this product to work as it should. It powered itself off within the first day of use, then powered itself off again about 4 hours later. I never set any timer or schedule on the device. If you decide to buy this product anyway, make sure you use devices that can tolerate sporadic power cuts for no reason. All their support department has told me to do is to perform a hard reset to fix this issue. After numerous inquiries, they still have not explained what caused it to power off by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Frank C

customer_reviews.title: Has issues working with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: So these both work and don't work. They work, in the sense that they are easy to install and turn on/off with no problems via a smart phone app. So far, I have no complaints there. Unfortunately, when it comes to Alexa, the "skill" for these does not fully work. You can often turn them on/off with Alexa commands. However, trying to set these into groups or routines via Alexa doesn't work; you get an error that the server is not responding. Please make sure to read the review for the Alexa skill needed to use these, and you'll see multiple other people having the same problem, with no apparent fix underway.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in AL

customer_reviews.title: Overall really good but a lot bigger than I thought
customer_reviews.text: Overall very easy to set up and connect to the network and controlled by my Echo. My only complaint would be the size. They are too big to put 2 of them into 1 outlet.
customer_reviews.author: Diamondfish

customer_reviews.title: Only connects to 2.4 Ghz but works great once it does.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these so I could use Alexa to turn to my Christmas lights on and off. They worked perfectly after getting around a wi-fi connection issue. These only work on a 2.4 Ghz network and my Comcast router is both 2.4 and 5.0 but would not connect. So I had to figure out how to create a dedicated 2.4 network to connect to before I could even try to set it up in the app. Took about a 1/2 hour as I couldn't really find anything on the Comcast website explaining how to do it but after that, it was as easy as plugging them in and saying "Alexa, turn on my Christmas lights."
customer_reviews.author: kick rocks

customer_reviews.title: This product has good reviews but I can't get it to work
customer_reviews.text: This product has good reviews but I can't get it to work. It does say it will not work with 5G networks but I have a dual band router with items on both bands but these will not choose the correct network and don't work.
customer_reviews.author: webjunky

customer_reviews.title: Connection issues
customer_reviews.text: There are two of them and I have tried to get both connected. I have even contacted their help desk, but they don't work for me. Important points I found out in my help desk exchange: They only work on a 2.4 network. Your network password must be less than 32 characters. You should turn off mobile data when you try to connect. To restart the device hold for a long count of 20, release when it starts to blink faster (it starts to blink at 10 seconds for pairing mode. As for me, all they do is have a blinky light.
customer_reviews.author: Rhia

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this it worked well but after a firmware update it started disconnecting from my network and when unplugged you have to reset the whole device. Not good when there's a power spike. When I contacted the company, the were eager to solve the problem but the wanted me to register so they can access the device. This is something I prefer not to do due to the variety of security issues. I wish there was a way I could roll back the firmware updated because it was working fine before. So beware that this might work for a while, but then just stop working out of the blue.
customer_reviews.author: zman

customer_reviews.title: 100% Satisfied - this mini outlet is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this set of mini outlets so that we would be able to control our Christmas lights. They have completely exceeded our expectation. The set-up with the VeSync app was simple and my husband and I were able to seamlessly get them to show up on both of our phones. On top of that, these work flawlessly with Alexa via our Echo Dot. Once we had all the lights set up, we set the timer to have them turn on and off at designated times and that has worked flawlessly so far too. Honestly - 100% satisfied and will likely be buying more of these in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Hastings Suhr

customer_reviews.title: works well with Echo
customer_reviews.text: Works great most times. Only issue is when there is a power outage, even a short blip, they turn off and loose connectivity with the wifi and need to be unplugged and then replugged to connect and turn back on. You know this as the blue light will blink identifying that they are not working. Thus if you are not home they will not function until you get home and re connect them. Not a good comfort level for when you want them to work while you are away as power outages and blips can occur at any time.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Reliable voice-controlled power sockets
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up for a great price on Black Friday, but would have been happy to pay the retail price for them. Setup was extremely easy, I simply downloaded the app, followed the instructions and within a minute had the plugs controlled via the app. Adding them to Alexa was similarly straightforward, and the app walked me through that process with no issues. I ran my indoor and outdoor holiday lights using these plugs, probably turning them on and off four times a day for six weeks, and have since moved them to control other lamps around the house, and have never had a problem with them at all.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Love it so much I ordered more ;)
customer_reviews.text: I love this outlet so much, that I ordered more....I have these things plugged into all my floor lamps and even my aquarium lights....they are all on a routine schedule so I never have to forget to turn them on or off, really convenient when your out of town...can always turn them in and make people think someone is home...and adding these plugs to my ap was a breeze, took less than a minute to connect them....first open your app, plug the outlet it then click add...then your set to use it
customer_reviews.author: Neal

customer_reviews.title: mixed feeling
customer_reviews.text: The ios app works as advertised. the product works great,.. very easy to install. just i am not able to do the technical network monitoring. and previous ( i saw late) reviews indicate that the product contacts and shares information with some chinese company. this to me is unacceptable. i cannot verify this because i dont have the know how to check it. but the idea of it doing so bothers me enough for me to give a 2 stars rating. other than that - google & amazon(usa) are also spying on my a$$ the whole frigging day. so levelling the playing field, im adding another .2 stars. didnt try alexa yet
customer_reviews.author: S-C-B

customer_reviews.title: Does not work.  Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Everything hinges on installing these via the VeSync app. Before you consider buying these, go read the reviews for the VeSync app -- they are universally terrible. I wasted over an hour trying to install these via my phone and on my tablet with no success -- it is unable to install at the 8% mark, tells me I need to move the outlet closer to the router, while it's sitting 3 feet from the router. I tried turning off the 5Ghz wireless on the router. Nothing. So, since I missed the return period, I wasted $27 on these. Worse, I needed these for a project that I can't complete. Do. Not. Buy. These. Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Janel A.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to replace an old-fashioned timer.
customer_reviews.text: After futzing with a variety of remote (radio) switches to turn my outdoor holiday lights off and on, I've found the perfect solution! I used the Etekcity outlet in my garage with the outlet powering all the temporary outdoor lights. I used the scheduling option and voila, lights are on! And I can stay nice and toasty warm in my PJs when they shut off on schedule. Setting it up was a breeze with the iphone app. I just plugged the outlet in my office, set it up, then moved it to the garage. I'm sure I'll find other more important uses, but this has brought me a little holiday joy at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: I never thought I could do this.
customer_reviews.text: I have always looked for a device that could turn on a lamp at sunset (a different time every day), and then turn off the lamp at the same time every day. The Voltson Smart Wi-Fi Outlet does that: on at sunset, off at midnight, every day. If there’s a power outage, no need to reset the time. And daylight savings time is automatically observed. You can set on/off at any specific time plus settings for sunrise and sunset. And I use another smart outlet for turning a differently named second light on and off using an Alexa voice command. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: A traveller

customer_reviews.title: Work for a few days and now will not turn things off. Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I went with these plugs over the Tocode plugs after a recommendation by someone in an Echo group I'm in. I had one set up for a fan in my bedroom and it worked for a few days and now it will turn the fan on but if you ask to turn it off it makes a click at the plug but doesn't shut off. Great quality. Geez.
customer_reviews.author: Ferretocious

customer_reviews.title: Love these things!  Instructions how to install here...
customer_reviews.text: Oh, man! Love these things for Alexa Dots and such! No more bending over and turning out those remote lights you just can't get to like sconces, kid's lava lamps, and the Christmas Tree! Just download the app to your phone first, then go to Alexa app second and click on Smart Devices. Pair it up with Alexa and you are golden! Look for "VeSync" app in Google Play store and type it in exactly as I have it or it will be hell to find. Download it and then do the Alexa thing I described.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Boy

customer_reviews.title: will not connect to my wifi
customer_reviews.text: Bought these in July... could not get them connect...followed the directions included. Emailed support, followed their instructions, still won't connect to my 2.4 Ghz network. Have tried on and off the last few months, keep updating the app, doesn't help, will not connect. I'll keep trying, since I don't want to return them. I bought the Amazon Smartthings outlets which worked immediately! I would not recommend these Etekcity outlets.
customer_reviews.author: C.L.

customer_reviews.title: Now my xmas tree turns itself on and off! Read about wifi bands.....
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper than the WEMO plugs. The app is a bit archaic, but works fine. **Be aware that these ONLY work on 2.4Ghz wireless band, so if you have your router at default, out-of-the box where 2.4 and 5Ghz bands are named the same SSID, you'll be in a world of hurt. Discretely name each of your networks and then you'll be set to go.**
customer_reviews.author: Kazam

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Great so far! The setup with the app and scheduling was super easy. I love coming home to my lights on especially in the winter when it gets dark by 4:30. It's cool that you can select "sunset" as a time for the lamps to come on so as the days get longer the lamps come on later. I even set a shut off time so I don't have to remember to turn the lamps off at all. The plugs are also smaller than some of the other models that I have seen. LOVE!
customer_reviews.author: cmoney

customer_reviews.title: Everything I ever hoped for
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up a year ago or so and have used them from everything from Christmas tree lights to tracking power consumption. I honestly have nothing but good things to say about these babies. Super simple set up with flawless Alexa integration. Setting routines in the app was very handy for getting that genuine pine shaped plastic of a Christmas tree glowing without having to hunch over the plug. For me the lack of hub necessity is a huge plus as I'm not sure I want to dive into that whole smart home thing yet. Currently using one to track power consumption on a mini-fridge I'm not sure is worth running.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: These have been working great for months
customer_reviews.text: Love these plugs. I use these with Google Home and they have speedy response times. I have some other branded switches such as Samsung SmartPlug, Insignia Smartplug, but the response is delayed a few more seconds. The app is snappy, it was quick to set up. I just wish I could integrate them into my Samsung SmartThings Hub so I could do more things with them. I've seen there is a code workaround in the forums but I can't figure it out. These are the best for the price and reliability. Haven't had any issues with them and I've used them for several months. I will purchase again when I need more and standardize to these plugs for my SmartHome.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna B.

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: I love these smart outlets. They are very reliable yet they’re one of the less expensive options on the market. We have about 6 of these plus in our home. They work flawlessly with our Amazon echoes. They’ve never lost connection and I’ve never had to reset them. The round shape prevents you from using two of them on the same outlet, however you can plug them into the bottom outlet which leaves the top outlet free for other devices. This limitation doesn’t bother me because if I need more than one lamp on the same smart switch, I just use a splitter. If I ever need more smart outlets, these are definitely the ones I’m getting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Mine arrived today and just installed one, it was flawless how easy it was and how quick.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 2 plug set and installed when today within 30 minutes after it arrived and it installed flawlessly and it was quick. I don't understand why there are any negative reviews. Actually these were much easier to set up then my more expensive brands. I wouldn't hesitate to buy more and I probably will as soon as I can find what else I want to control. So far everything in my place is connected to Alexa. So the fact that they were easier and at a fraction seriously a fraction of the price. The long and the short of it is that I highly recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Radiospotz

customer_reviews.title: What a great little product
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. The ability to turn outlets on and off from my phone is cool. The ability to monitor power usage is great. The app you use to control them is simple and easy to use and lets you program times to turn them on as well as countdowns and has a few other features I haven’t even explored yet. I’m currently using these to turn my Christmas tree on/off but even after Christmas there will be so many uses. Turning lights on before you come home atnight or on and off while on vacation, monitoring power, turning off things like set top boxes over night when they just suck power...
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Redding

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup works with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Love these smart plugs. Bought them cheap when they were on sale after Xmas. Been using them almost a year now. They are super easy to setup and integrate with Alexa. The Etekcity (VeSync) app is easy to use and getting them into Alexa was easier than a lot of other integrations for smart devices. Well done and fun to play with plugging in different things and telling Alexa to turn it off/on. It will be great this coming Xmas season. The ease of setting up a timed schedule for Xmas lights using these will be GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonProShopper

customer_reviews.title: EASY set up!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to automate outlets for Alexa. When they arrived, I downloaded the required app and named the outlets. The enabled the skill in Alexa and they worked perfectly. From opening the package to finish took maybe 10 minutes. I would recommend these outlets w/o reservation and am sure I will purchase more in the future. Update: 08/16/18 These plugs are still performing well. In fact, I have bought another pair. I've found that you can schedule the plugs via the app. So these can be used like one of the old timers that have the tabs that you pop in and out to control the lights. I'm still very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K

customer_reviews.title: Great, EZ to setup with Echo
customer_reviews.text: Great, easy setup once you download the app... connection to my dot was no issue and took less than 5 minutes... My issue is that the 2nd plug from the two pack does not seem to stay on, or connected... light will turn on via voice... than after 5 minutes just turn off... wont turn back on unless i completely unplug the smart plug from the wall and basically reset it... the problem continues to happen even when trying it with other devices such as my coffee maker...
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for those awkward lights.
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine today and love them already! Initially, I was confused because there are three apps on Google Play for VeSync, but once I figured out that it was specifically, VeSync Outlet, that I wanted, it was a breeze. It hooks up to Alexa skills with zero fuss at all. I'm already looking around the house and wondering what else I can switch to these plugs. I chose two really awkward lights. The last lamp to go off at night downstairs, which leaves me to walk to the stairs in darkness, was a shoe-in. A bedroom lamp that's on the other side of a bed made for a great second choice.
customer_reviews.author: A ChristyTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Intelligent product
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy to follow and worked like a charm. Bought these to control my Christmas tree lights with Google Home. I like that I can also use them to turn the lights off and on from my phone while not at home. A plus is that their app monitors the electricity usage. You can even put in your cost per kWh and get an estimate of how much energy is costing you for the plug. I also set these up on a schedule. Their app includes a vacation schedule which will randomly turn things on and off during set hours and I am excited to test that out this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, broken. Replacement also broken.
customer_reviews.text: Tried to use one to program my cat feeder. It does not work. Not reliable. Scheduling turns it on for maybe 1/2 a second, then it turns it off, then immediately on, and never turns off. If you try to access it through wifi after this, it won't work. You need to manually reset it for it to work again. But then it does the same on SOME of the scheduled times. I contacted the company, and they graciously sent a new one within a few days. Guess what... same thing. A shame cause if it worked it'd be great. 1 star for product, with an additional star for customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Bleen

customer_reviews.title: Use to Remotely Remotely Reboot Home Computer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first Etekcity Smart Plug a year ago to have the ability to remotely boot my Dell desktop computer. I spend a lot of time out of town and remotely access my home computer. Every now and then I loose connectivity to the computer. With my Etekcity Smart Plug I can remotely power down and restart the desktop computer. I had to change a BIOS setting so the computer will automatically boot up when power has been restored. Works perfectly. I have since purchased 3 more to control lighting. No issues at all after 1 year of use!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with instructions that were easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with instructions that were easy to follow. Within a half hour I had both outlets running my outdoor Christmas lights. Another 15 minutes and I had them turning on and off again at specific times. I also easily connected both to Alexa so I can turn them on/off with a voice command. If they remain reliable, they're the best investment of the holiday season. (I'm in IT and learn new technologies fast, FWIW) One bonus over other brands -- these do track your energy usage. I haven't played with this option much, yet, but it is intriguing. I plan on buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Brian From MN

customer_reviews.title: Android set-up problems
customer_reviews.text: Android user warning: if you don't have an iPad or iPhone in your house, you may not be able to set this up. I kept getting a message on my Galaxy that said I may have too many end points connected to my router. I read other reviews and decided to try through my iPad instead and it worked easily. It was frustrating. AFTER set up, it works fine from my android. If you don't have Apple products for initial set-up, save yoirself some frustration and buy Kasa instead. If it's too late, borrow a friends iPad or iphone for set-up. Delete the app from that device after set-up and log into app on your own android device.
customer_reviews.author: kow

customer_reviews.title: Smart plugs are supposed to simplify your life. These aren't those plugs.
customer_reviews.text: App is laughable. It's as if the creators ran the Chinese through an online translator and then added it to the app. I always read the on screen text with a Chinese voice in my head. Power monitor is hilariously inaccurate and spotty; it often reads 0.00. Physical plugs are just as big a flaming pile as the app. The plugs will not reconnect if router settings or passwords are changed, no matter how many times you reset or try advanced settings. Alexa constantly tells me the plugs are offline and will not interact. There have to be better plugs that actually work, are easier to configure, have an app that isn't frustrating, and reliably interact with Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: DatNinjaDan

customer_reviews.title: Use VeSyncOutlet app NOT VeSync app like the directions say
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to give 5 Stars, but can't for a very easily prevented reason. The quick start materials guide the user to the vesync app... After hours of my husband and I trying to connect, we nearly packaged the plugs up to send back. Then my husband stumbled on the vesync outlet app and we literally connected in under 30 seconds. Please please please correct the inserts in the packages to reflect the right app. It was an entirely horrid customer experience. We now have it connected to our Alexa with no issues and are happy with the product but shouldn't have had to figure it out ourselves.
customer_reviews.author: JBean

customer_reviews.title: Took less than 20 minutes to set up both
customer_reviews.text: We have pets and occasionally are unable to return before it gets dark. At the same time, we usually have our hands full at night when going up to bed. These remote plugs were simple to set up. I linked then to my cell phone voice command and can turn the lights on remotely, anytime and anywhere. At night, we merely tell Alexa to turn the lights on/off while we have our hands full. The price was great for both, quite a bargain in fact. I would gladly buy more....just thinking of a way to get a simpler coffeemaker so I can tell it to turn on in the morning before I come down.
customer_reviews.author: ProlificK

customer_reviews.title: 1200 watt limit at 10A draw.
customer_reviews.text: I was attempting to use this to automate a window AC but the spike current draw for the compressor just shuts this off. Would probably work in less energy-intense applications but it's useless to me. Also, it apparently sends your data to China, which is not something everyone wants/cares about.
customer_reviews.author: Johann Grimm

customer_reviews.title: can't activate
customer_reviews.text: I could not get the plugs to register on my network. I tried configuring them with android app on Samsung S8. I was able to follow the app instructions up until the point where it says to go connect to the AP** network. I connected to it, then pressed the back-arrow to go back to the app, but the app was stuck at the place where it asks me to connect to the AP** network. Pressing the button just brought me back to my wifi configuration. Stuck in a loop. I was contacted by the seller asking if things went well; I responded that I needed help but the seller never responded.
customer_reviews.author: rex

customer_reviews.title: All failed - unreliable - However a customer service of ****
customer_reviews.text: I use the product for both security and convenience. That fact that all 6 units failed at the same time makes them useless. They are going in the trash. Update - Soon after writing this review I was contacted by the manufacturer of the product. They offered advice on recovering the connection with the product and I tried what they suggested, all to no avail. At that point the offered a full refund, this some 11 months after the purchase. The refund was recorded in my card account today. Regardless of what went wrong with the product, I appreciate their standing behind it. It's a credit to the way they do business, not something one experiences a lot these days.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott

customer_reviews.title: It turns on just fine, but Alxea can't turn it off.
customer_reviews.text: I have it connected to a small oscillating fan that I set to low speed. It turns on just fine and Alxea responds with "OK". When I ask Alexa to turn the fan off, it won't turn off and Alexa says "mmm... the fan is not responding", or she just flashes her lights and says nothing. If I turn the fan off manually and then as Alexa to turn the switch off she responds with "OK" and the plug is ready to turn on the next time. It doesn't seem to be able to turn an inductive (motor) load off.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Be very careful to follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the setup instructions, these inexpensive smart plugs work and work well. I had some frustration during setup because my WiFi password is complicated and I had it misspelled on my smartphone, so the device wouldn't connect (you can't see how you spelled it). On top of that, my smartphone is using a VPN, which won't allow setup until you disconnect it. This latter condition caused a similar problem with another brand of plugs, too, but they don't warn you about VPNs in the setup instructions. Bottom line, I'm happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: JPV

customer_reviews.title: Best product I've used so far with Alexa and controlling outlets
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several devices with Alexa in mind to turn items on and off. This item by far exceeds the others in terms of ease of setup, simplicity of use, and ability to detect WiFi signal. Another AWESOME thing about this is that you can name each outlet whatever you want and Alexa will recognize the name. So, instead of saying "Alexa turn off Switch 1 or 2," you can say "Alexa, turn off bedroom lamp." If you are looking for something to use with Alexa to turn electronic items on and off I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: JRSmith

customer_reviews.title: working smart wifi plugs work with alexa
customer_reviews.text: these items were purchased on sale. prior to purchasing them i have had no experience with this vendor. product packaging was nice and minimal. directions were simple. having already configured smart outlets before, this wasn’t much different. you download an app to get the devices communicating with the wifi router. then you add the alexa skill in the alexa app. then you’re done! so far, these work as expected and at the sale price i would certainly buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Reyna

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool outlets! I know some folks have had issues. I think they just didn't pay close attention to the disclaimers on the description (just like me initially). I had some issues getting them up and running because I didn't closely follow the directions. Once I got my router squared away though, they linked right up. I've been using them with Alexa for a good while now with absolutely no issues. The only disappointment is that you can't sink them with SmartThings. Getting this fixed would take these to a 5 out of 5 rating!
customer_reviews.author: Allan B. Conner

customer_reviews.title: great smart plugs, good price
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised with these plugs. for the cost, I assumed they would be a little flaky, bad software or something. I downloaded the app, plugged one it and very easily and quickly had it working. far easier than the more pricy Wemo switch I have. it also reacts quickly. from the app it is almost instant (ie. you hit the button on the app it turns on or off), maybe a half second delay. from Alexa or Google Home it has a slight delay, but not bad and no where near as long as the Wemo.
customer_reviews.author: Code Monkey

customer_reviews.title: Dont upload the wrong app from the app store or it wont work
customer_reviews.text: Yes this product does work and is quite handy except for the downloading the wrong app first. They have the one with the tag OUTLET and that is the old one and does not work. Once I got the right one and changed to 2.5 on my router its all good. It does work with google home but is a bit confusing. I have both an office and a home to control. Its a little hard to reassign the device to a different address once you have activated it. I also found I had to hit hit off or on more than once when it read green for example but was in fact not on.
customer_reviews.author: mojo

customer_reviews.title: This is a great addition to our smart home.
customer_reviews.text: We have one light that is Alexa controlled, but hardwired. I like the plugs because you can move them to a different room and they still work. The set-up with Alexa was a little confusing, but we got there, and now have flawless verbal control over our smart plugs. The house is very dark at night, so it is nice to be able to verbally ask for a lamp to go on before you enter a room and trip over something in the dark. I would buy these smart plugs again.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B

customer_reviews.title: A very good product !
customer_reviews.text: Product is well designed. ( However, the size will not allow you to install 2 on a duplex wall outlet- but there are ways around that) Set up was extremely easy, made connection to WiFi in about a minute. Web App was easy to navigate and use to customize settings. So far working flawlessly. Operation can be controlled by preset schedule, Alexa, or your phone. ( when using Alexa, make sure you use the same sequence of words- shift one and you may think the Smart Plug is not working) As of now, very satisfied, but too early to comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Jag

customer_reviews.title: App needed wont work so plugs can't work
customer_reviews.text: Very excited to get these for my Christmas tree and lights. Downloaded needed app and tried to register and tells me I can't that my email is wrong. No, I've had it for 29yrs. Tried to use my work email instead no, Google email nope. Continue to get email fail. Printing return label to send back. 12hrs later tried again, excepted my email. Never sent me an email also says my internet does not have the right connections. Thought plug would make my life simpler but has not. Still sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Bsugar

customer_reviews.title: So simple, yet so AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought these before winter. I have this hooked up to my torpedo heater and shop lights in my pole barn. It's been pretty awesome to turn everything on remotely rather than head outside in 3°F to turn things on at 4am. I set an alarm, turn it on, go back to sleep. I havent tried the Alexa integration, but was told SHE CAN TURN IT ON FOR ME!!! WHAT?? It almost has me excited for next winter! Range is good too. My plug is easily 80-100 feet from my router.
customer_reviews.author: Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bad News
customer_reviews.text: We used these for just over 2 years. We then received notification that the app was going to not work anymore. Update to the new app. We updated the app as instructed. Guess what! The plugs no longer work. Called their customer service. To bad, so sad...you are are 2 weeks past our warranty. But we did what your notification told us to do. After reading some of the reviews regarding China, I am thrilled they stopped working. Don't buy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Work flawlessly, may buy more
customer_reviews.text: I bought a two-pack so we could add them to our Alexa-powered smart home setup. While I wasn't entirely sure where I would use them when we got them, we soon found some useful applications. These were easy to set up and both have worked flawlessly -- including after power outages and Wi-Fi outages. I wanted smart plugs that would also monitor electricity use so we could work on reducing electricity bills, or at least understanding our usage. I put one of them on a suspected "power vampire" that we rarely use. I will see if it results in lower bills soon. Overall, I'm happy and would definitely buy this brand again if I need more smart plugs.
customer_reviews.author: E. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Better Value than the Wemo
customer_reviews.text: Originally was going to go for the TP-Link smart plugs but went with these instead because they are smaller and track energy usage for a cheaper price. Set up was pretty painless and it seems to work well for my purposes - remote resetting of electrical components. The only things that could be improved is that they make a loud "click" when switching on/off and the app could be a little less buggy - needed to restarted it here and there. But otherwise, the app is pretty slick and I might buy another.
customer_reviews.author: James Newell

customer_reviews.title: Works well, good app
customer_reviews.text: I bought these not realizing they monitor energy usage and now I use them everywhere in my house - for lamps that are a pain to turn on, and for my computer APC backup to keep an eye on usage. The app lets you put in a $/kWh rate so you can eyeball cost easily, and gives you week/month/year graphs as well. I haven't had any of the connectivity issues others are talking about, but perhaps during setup try to do it on an outlet near the router and then move it to the new location?
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why others had issues setting up, easy peesie,
customer_reviews.text: Delivered fast, downloaded phone app, took five minutes connect, Alexa took 2 minutes to find and works perfect. UPDATE BOUGHT TWO MORE, Update, no issues with these , love the ease of set up.
customer_reviews.author: Tom H

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up AND They Work
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these smart switches and they are much better than another brand I've struggled with. The other ones won't reliably connect to my WIFI network and has experienced numerous failures because the company's servers have issues. These from Etekcity work very well and setting up automated schedules to turn lights on and off are simple from the iPhone app. It's nice to not have issues constantly. Now admittedly, the other company set the bar for success very low, but I'm very happy with the Voltson (Vesync) devices. They work well with our Echo Dot; the only thing I wish is that they would also support Homekit (Siri), but I can live with Alexa only.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, bad guidance
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying that now that the issues with set up have passed, the product works great. The problem was that I worked for a week trying to get the wifi outlet to connect without success. I looked online, contacted customer service online and tried every combination of instructions given. Then I called Customer Service and they said, oh you have an Android phone. That app doesn't work with those. You have to download this app instead. 10 minutes later, connected. Really, you don't think that's worth putting on your website? Very poor judgment. Otherwise, great!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mussmacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent WiFi Smart Plugs, would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. worked like a charm. Downloaded the app, plugged in the devices and they immediately acquired the WiFi signal. Now, they turn on my coffee pot and toaster. One caveat regarding the toaster! I tried to use it with my four toaster unit and it caused a problem. It says that it's good up to 1200 watts, so perhaps using both sides at once was too much wattage. Now I just use one side of the toaster at a time. I also have TP-link units, however, the Etekcity WiFi smart plugs are infinitely better in my view!
customer_reviews.author: LAH2000

customer_reviews.title: Never got them to work
customer_reviews.text: ok, i have just spent about two hours trying to get these to work. i had to learn how to disable the 5G part of my router, i had to setup a vesync account, i had to switch between an "espxxx" network back and forth with my home network. And no success. So i went to the support site for vesync. Went through all of the steps. All i can say is that i am generally pretty good at this techy stuff--but i have not been able to get either of mine to work. Oh, i forgot to mention the three youtube videos i watched in order to connect. I'm tossing these........
customer_reviews.author: life is good

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding customer service and product support
customer_reviews.text: It's a pack of two and in my case one died in 5 minutes and the other one died within a day. Why the 4 starts then? Because this company stands by the quality control and product support. Right after I contacted their customer service, Etekcity offered to replace defective units and send me two more units to prove that my original experience was rather unfortunate exception than a common occurrence. I'm testing the two complimentary units now and they work as intended. If they last for couple more weeks I'll update my review to five starts for solid customer service and product support. Things happen but it takes a real company to make things right. Thank you, Etekcity.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. V

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising
customer_reviews.text: This product is false advertising. It does not connect with amazon alexa. You are required to set up an account with Vesync in order to connect to amazon alexa. However when you make an account with Vesync and try to connect it to the amazon alexa app, it says that your username does not exist. I spoke with an online help person from the Vesync app and "Kim" told me that there have been many users complaining that it does not connect to their amazon alexa. Furthermore, the lady "Kim" ended the chat very rudely and nothing was solved.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Description - Requires their App and Only usable for 10A devices or less
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these to use with my Alexa so I could control my Air-Conditioners. Come to find out according to the tiny instructions that you have to install their proprietary app before syncing it with Alexa and that it will only work with devices with a max current of 10A. Having to install a third party app is not "Working Flawlessly with Alexa" and the 10A limitation was never mentioned in the product description. This was a total ripoff and is now essentially useless to me. Serious misrepresentation about the usefulness of these smart plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Slaine Fullerton

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous!! Do not buy it!!
customer_reviews.text: This is DANGEROUS! If I could give this zero stars, I would!! My son was plugging this in when a spark and a surge of electricity hit him. It blew the entire outlet, scorched the plug, and even burnt a piece of the plate cover off (see attached pic). The what ifs that run through my mind are scary. What if it had happened after it was plugged in and no one was home? What if there had been a long curtain hanging down nearby? What if it had seriously injured my son? I do not recommend buying this at all!!
customer_reviews.author: BuckeyeJ

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a year.... then I bought a new router and guess what? I can't get it to reconnect. Buy the Amazon plugs.... I plugged it in and BINGO right off the bat with the new router it's working flawlessly.......I've also had that for a year as well...... I do NOT work for Amazon, I didn't get anything to give their plug a + review...... all I can tell you is that they just work! EtekCity........don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: great, easy way to start / ease into smart home.
customer_reviews.text: perfect if you are looking for a wifi / smart outlet for your home that you can control by your phone, or integrate with the Amazon Echo series. I use this to control lights around the house... infact, I did a video of this on my youtube channel "garniebolling" , look for the video on May 31, 2017. easy to set up easy to control has a schedule program to turn on and off lights for you why I bought two more :) will be using these for other items in the house like Christmas lights or other lamp fixtures.
customer_reviews.author: Garnie In Texas

customer_reviews.title: So far, they all still work!
customer_reviews.text: Had bought several smart plugs from Woot and had them fail within the month. Luckily Woot, even before Amazon bought them, was good at returns and failed products. If they hadn't been, would not have been a favorite go-to place for reasonable prices. These plugs were easy to set up and while it is a learning curve to finally know how to save the settings on the software (clicking the green check mark if memory serves) they have been performing well. The software has an "Away" setting to turn lights on and off randomly to look more like you're at home. Would like to canvas thieves to see if this confounds them.
customer_reviews.author: John Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with cappuccino machine
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there is a limit to the wattage these things can handle. Tried these in place of the Gosund plugs which quit working after a few weeks. The Etekcity plugs work with no load, but when plugging in a home type cappuccino machine the machine turned on for 5 seconds and then turned off. Tried both the plugs that came in the two pack: same result. The only thing I can figure is that the machine drew too many watts. I went back to my old WeMo plug which seems to be working. Have the new WeMo mini on order since that will work with Apple Home Kit in addition to Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyH

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat works as described, but...
customer_reviews.text: I am using one of the outlets to simply turn on & off a light and most of the time it works but sometimes Alexa says 'ok' but the light does not change state... this has happened a dozen times or more. The Vesync App does not operate as described on my cellphone. I have an Android ZTE Citrine II 4G LTE phone and the Vesync App fails to display the Timer and Energy Savings Menu's. I sent an email to Etekcity describing the problem but have not received any response from them to date. i am waiting for a response before I try the 2nd outlet.
customer_reviews.author: XYZ

customer_reviews.title: Product changed and now requires a new, additional app
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set out outlets a year or so ago and loved them. They connected through my "Smart Life" App which tons of other smart products utilize. I liked this because it gave me one portal and one service to use. Now, however, a year latter I am purchasing this product and it require the downloading of a new app. Did a little research and I just don't trust it. Seems that they route a lot of information overseas. I don't need another app with access to my email and entire phone's worth of info. Got returned.
customer_reviews.author: HikerNerd

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Set up was fine at first, and was able to connect with Alexa for voice commands. Then we upgraded our wifi to business speed, which required a new router. It is literally IMPOSSIBLE to get these devices to sync to Alexa after that. This probably has to do with running on the higher speed, but I don't have the option of switching to 2.4Ghz. The fact that these only work with certain routers should've been disclosed. The app is a joke. Not intuitive at all. Settings are useless. You can't change anything within your existing account, as most links are greyed out. You'd think linking something to a new wifi network would be simple... Guess not. Garbage. Waste of $.
customer_reviews.author: Yanx21

customer_reviews.title: Set up was fairly easy and they respond well to commands
customer_reviews.text: Use these to control lamps in my living room and bedroom. Works well with the google assistant and the google home and home mini that I have in my house. Set up was fairly easy and they respond well to commands. At times though, lights will turn off on their own without any commands or any timers being set. I havent quite figured out if thats a glitch in the plug or something else. Otherwise, its a cheaper alternative to buying smart bulbs for the whole house. Also, the plugs can take up a lot of space at the outlet and cause the other to become unusable. I will still be buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Xavier S.Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Loses network connection when powered down
customer_reviews.text: These are relatively easy to set up, but once you use the wireless application to turn the power off, the plug loses its connection to the network and it must be set up again. I have it set to power a small space heater in our bedroom. Before I go to sleep, I turn off the heater, using the app on my phone. In the morning, the plug has lost its network connection and I must get out of bed and either go through the setup process to turn it back on or unplug the space heater and re-plug it into the wall socket, directly. Automation that causes more work than without the automated gizmo is a waste. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Do not work reliably with the app
customer_reviews.text: The plugs are ok but the app vesync is terrible and works about 70% of the time. Rest of the time you have to manually turn the plugs on.King of goes against the point of owning smart plugs. After using the few for couple of days, I gave up on it. I am using home assistant now which recently added support for vesync plugs and it has been working reliably for couple of months. Good buy if you you use something other than the vesync app to control it.
customer_reviews.author: Dilpreet Singh

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, a little tricky to setup
customer_reviews.text: Overall, these plugs work just as advertised. I hooked up my stereo amplifier to it so we can turn it on/off through our phone app on another level in the house. So far, it's worked like a charm. The only downside is that setting it up wasn't very clear. The different colors that it "blinks" are very similar and they don't flash as stated in the manual. With a little patience however, I figured it out and almost a year later they haven't failed yet. I'd definitely buy again if I need more.
customer_reviews.author: bricker71

customer_reviews.title: Better than WeMo.
customer_reviews.text: These things work like a freaking charm. Follow the directions and it’s easy to set up, and it always gets the command on the first try, unlike we ma these things work like a freaking charm. Follow the directions and it’s easy to set up, and it always gets the command on the first try, unlike WeMo, which I have issues with, and it always would say “having trouble connecting”. For real. I’d buy more just to have 6 of these in my room and have Alexa control my life lol
customer_reviews.author: REDSOUZA

customer_reviews.title: Work well but check your amperage requirements
customer_reviews.text: These plugs aren't bad and they do work well for what I use them for however, there are a couple of things to be aware of. They are larger than they appear and they are limited to 8 amps. Normally 8 amps is fine but be aware that these aren't suitable for higher amp uses. I'm using these to control lights on my porch so they are fine for my use and they have always responded to Alexa commands. They also have good specs regarding operating temperatures so I have been happy with the plugs. The phone app does what is expected and hooking up to my wireless network was easy.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Simple automation in seconds
customer_reviews.text: As a standalone product impressed with the quality of the outlets and the capabilities of the mobile app. I particularly liked that within the app I was able to set up two lamps individually and then group them so that I could turn both on and off simultaneously. This feature works extremely well and I have integrated with Alexa, which recognizes the group name when I speak it. Other capabilities within the app include the ability to set a schedule, set timers and view consumption to name a few. I would have expected these features from a much more expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Genoway

customer_reviews.title: YAS!
customer_reviews.text: I'm thrilled with these. I had my echo turning my lamp on and off within 5 minutes from taking this out of the box. Set up to my wireless network and the Echo Dot was easy thanks to a simple process and simple directions from the apps. It sounds silly but not having to reach for the light switch anymore is a total game changer! If you have an Echo/Alexa you'd be crazy not to invest in these and start moving into the future. (The only "downside" is that it basically takes up the space of two outlets but I was fully expecting that anyway.)
customer_reviews.author: Avery

customer_reviews.title: Buy Something Else. Save your time and $.
customer_reviews.text: A) Don't buy it, it never sent it's information to connect. B) If you do buy, be ready to return right away, there is a short return window. C) Forget customer support unless you can be with your plug from 9am to 5pm M-F. D) Not buying anything from this brand again. E) And the instructions weren't any good either. F) Not my first rodeo I have wireless, tvs, cameras, speakers, printers and that's just what I can see from my desk.
customer_reviews.author: ANTONIO A. SAN MARTIN

customer_reviews.title: Addictive—once you shop, you won’t be able to stop...purchase one for every devise!
customer_reviews.text: Electricity made simple and super convenient. Adore the ability to control a wide range and large number of devices from wherever I happen to be at any given moment. If you plug it into an outlet, you can control it by the phone in your pocket. Exterior terrace lighting, decorative dewdrop lighting, Pottery Barn Adair Floor Lamps, Pottery Barn Desk Lamp, Jonathan Adler Elephant Night Light, Crane Drop Ultrasonic Humidifier — just a few of the many devices these charms permit me to manage all from a single device I already have reason to hold in my hand. Beware—they’re addictive—purchase a single set and count the days until you cave and purchase a second, third, ...tenth...
customer_reviews.author: Kanne

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could turn my photo lights on and off with voice control, and so far they're working okay. I did notice that if I unplug one to move it to a new location, it keeps its name and wifi connection if I get it plugged back in right away. But if I wait too long, I have to set it up again. Now that I've got them where I need them, it shouldn't be problem, and hopefully they'll keep the connection now.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: So easy! Please read the top review for this product for the how-to, since they don't put the Echo/Alexa connection instructions in the box. it is so simple and takes 2-3 minutes per outlet to set up. I have been using timers for so long now, that it has taken me forever to swap them out. So much happier with this system. (I like to keep lights on for safety, coming back in at night, etc). great product for the price, and I have other etekcity products that I swear by....
customer_reviews.author: eac

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't buy this product to switch something on/off which is does just fine, but to monitor power use which also appears to be fine. One of the smart plugs has gone off-line and switched itself off randomly 3 times now in less than 2 weeks use. To get it to come back on I had to unplug it, plug it back in and turn it on. As the loads absolutely must be powered I am returning the smart plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa and Josh

customer_reviews.title: smart plug, sorta
customer_reviews.text: these work and are cheaper than some ridiculous ones but more expensive than ones that do the same thing. however, they do not talk to the same app as either. if you've already started your collection with something, this will require yet another app. this fact and the idea that I'm starting to use more smart bulbs than outlets, these may become giveaways soon. they also take a lot a space and cannot be doubled up with much on a single gang outlet
customer_reviews.author: Daryl S.

product_meta.title: VeSync Smart Plug by Etekcity, 2 Pack Mini WiFi Outlets, Works with Alexa, Google Home & IFTTT, Remote Control from Anywhere, WiFi Energy Monitoring with Schedule Function, No Hub Required, ETL Listed
product_meta.description: Manage your home, even from afar. Control from afar The Etekcity Voltson WiFi Electrical Outlet empowers you to remotely control your appliances, whether directly with your VeSync app (on your smartphone/tablet), or with Alexa voice control set up at home. Use it at home, from the office, or even from a cafe with Wi-Fi. Even create custom schedules so you can ditch double-checking your appliances all the time! Make your home smart at saving energy and costs Smart management actually helps eliminate excess consumption of electricity, since household devices can still eat up energy, even when not in use. This outlet also monitors a device's power usage via the VeSync app, so you know how much power each device uses. Be smart about home! Save on your bill, and save valuable energy. Streamline home security Moreover, for the extended days you're away, replace old-fashioned timers that are limited in function. This smart outlet can turn on lamps on a set schedule, or at a moment's notice as you're miles away. Amazon Alexa Setup 1. Open Amazon Alexa APP on your phone; 2. Search for Skill "VeSync" and enable; 3. Sign in to your VeSync account in Alexa; 3. Go to Alexa Smart Home section and Discover your Devices; 4. Finish. Control your devices using Alexa. Please note that your VeSync account is case sensitive, so make sure you have entered the right account in Alexa. Or they will tell you account doesn't exist.
feature_bullets: Works with Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant for voice control. Power your devices without lifting a finger. Does NOT currently support Smart Things, Homekit
Track power usage for connected devices and figure out which devices use the most energy. You can effectively cut your usage so that you can save more on your next electric bill
Easy to install and stable connection. Controlled from different devices and manage your home on your smart phone from anywhere
Get ready to have a smart home by setting your special groups. Control an entire group with a single tap, whether you’re lying in bed or away from home
Never miss a beat by organizing your Etekcity smart products into groups, and control an entire group with a single tap, whether you’re lying in bed or away from home

specifications.Plug Format: B - US style with ground plug.
